setup_instructions.step_1: Go to Cloudflare Dashboard → Workers & Pages → Pages.
setup_instructions.step_2: Click Create → Pages project (⚠️ NOT Worker).
setup_instructions.step_3: Connect GitHub repo: BlueberryCloud/ShareWithFriends (branch: master or v2).
setup_instructions.step_5: Click Save and Deploy. Wait for deployment to finish.
setup_instructions.reset_note: If deployment fails with 'cp: not found' or similar, go to Settings → Build & Deploy and reapply step_4.

mechanism_explained.github_integration: When you push a commit to the repo, Cloudflare Pages automatically fetches the repo contents.
mechanism_explained.build_stage: Normally Pages runs a build step (npm, Hugo, etc). With our custom command, we skip that by running a no-op.
mechanism_explained.deployment_stage: After skipping the build, Pages directly publishes the files from the repo root ('/').
mechanism_explained.domain_mapping: Every Pages project gets a <project>.pages.dev domain. Our project name 'sharewithfriends' maps to 'sharewithfriends.pages.dev'.
mechanism_explained.why_custom_build: Without the no-op command, Cloudflare auto-generates a build script that fails because our repo has no Node, Hugo, or dist/ output. The custom build tells Pages to just copy static files as-is.
